intro: Varronia leucomalla, commonly known as the white-veined varronia, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, elliptical leaves with prominent white veins. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, round berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
